question: 人気
sourceAnswer:
<read>にんき</read>:: popularity/public-favor | condition-(e.g.-market)/tone/character/nature
<read>ひとけ</read>|<read>ひとげ</read>:: sign-of-life/human-presence | humanity/humaneness
sourceMnemonic: If a <kanji>person</kanji> has a lot of <kanji>energy</kanji> then they're very charismatic and fun! What's another feature of charismatic / fun people? They are most likely <vocabulary>popular</vocabulary> as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> and <ja>気</ja> both have two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you:

You're so <vocabulary>popular</vocabulary> that you've been given the <reading>Nin</reading>tendo <reading>key</reading> (<ja>にんき</ja>). That's right, Nintendo gave you the master key to their entire office. Just like that.

This is a lot of responsibility even for your levels of popularity, so be careful not to lose this key!
